H0.text: The object bends without breaking is an example of a physical property of an object.

H1.text: The object bubbles when put into an acid is an example of a physical property of an object.

H2.text: The object burns when touched by a flame is an example of a physical property of an object.

H3.text: The object gives off sparks when put into water is an example of a physical property of an object.

A4.text: The physical properties of an object that are traditionally defined by classical mechanics are often called mechanical properties.

A5.text: Physical properties are contrasted with chemical properties which determine the way a material behaves in a chemical reaction.
